Class TimePi

  • java.lang.Object
    • TimePi

  • public class TimePi
extends java.lang.Object
    This program generates timing data for exploring the performance of a small cluster as the number of nodes and threads per node scales. Times the estimation of Pi using Monte Carlo integration. Assumes cluster has 8 nodes, with hostnames as seen in the field serverNames.
    Version:
    8.15.2017
    Author:
    Vincent A. Cicirello

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX
      Number of samples for longest run.
      static java.lang.String[][] serverNames
      An array of arrays of RMI server names.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimePi() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Generates timing data for estimating Pi via Monte Carlo integration for: (a) sequential implementation, (b) concurrent threads executing locally, and (c) remote threads started via RMI calls.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • MAX

        public static final int MAX
        Number of samples for longest run.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • serverNames

        public static final java.lang.String[][] serverNames
        An array of arrays of RMI server names. Each array is for one experimental condition (e.g., list of servers). For example, the first array has a single server (for runs with 1 remote server), the second has two (for runs with 2 remote servers), etc. Note rpi0.local is the master node of the cluster, so the runs that include it use a mix of remote and local threads.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimePi

        public TimePi()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Generates timing data for estimating Pi via Monte Carlo integration for: (a) sequential implementation, (b) concurrent threads executing locally, and (c) remote threads started via RMI calls. Note: This assumes that the RMI servers have been started already. Otherwise, this will throw an exception at run time when it attempts to make RMI calls.
        Parameters:
        args - No command line arguments. Ignored.
